comment: Professor Mahmoud is great. He is a good lecturer and explains everything we need to know clearly, without spending time on unnecessary topics. I felt like every minute spent in class was a productive one. He is helpful outside of class and gives lots of opportunities to improve grades. Not only that, he is a decent, well-rounded person in general.

Took 6650. HW & Tests were challenging & lengthy. You have a full day to work on the Test (open book). He does curve grades & drops the lowest scores, giving students a chance to raise their grades. Which is great! Lectures were good. There were 7 homework assignments, f6 quizzes, 3 Tests, & a Final Exam.

A prof. that wants you to learn/succeed in a topic that he is clearly passionate & knowledgeable about. Pay attention to the lectures (they are easy to listen to), complete the HW/quizzes and you are guaranteed to do well on the tests. My only grief is that the online summer class is all pre-recorded from prior semesters so it feels disconnected..

Professor Mahmoud was one of the best I've had at KSU so far, he's super caring and helps by giving us partial credit on exams. He also teachers very well (went a little fast for me). I would highly reccomend studying in groups, it's super useful! I got a super high C but unfortunately he was unable to curve it to a B, Regardless, take him!

He is such a good professor which is hard to find at KSU, he is a cool guy and his lectures are just example problems. The test are just homework problems and so is the final exam. He is very knowledgeable in engineering. Weekly quizzes which were easy and weekly homework.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Unbelievably goated actually amazing professor there's nothing I cant say about how great this man is he takes care of students if you see him for a class TAKE HIM

He's generally a good dude that cares about the material and his students. The material can be rough but he is pretty good at covering it and encourages questions as well as willing to help if you don't understand. Homework and quizzes are weekly but all test questions are taken from the HW so they're easy to study for.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Very good professor. Throughout the semester, it made me learn to actually be a better student from how he gives out his quizzes, homeworks and prelabs, which are usually due on sundays. He grades fair, if you don't do what is due, you don't get the grade period. This dude actually made me a better student because of this.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Mahmoud has great lectures, is willing to help outside of class, and accommodate if you have a problem. His class is very straightforward with grades in tests, quizzes, homework, and lab work which are all spaced out evenly. His grading is very fair and has room for extra credit. Also allows a cheat sheet for every test.

Excellent in explaining materials and goes through a lot of problems.  I learnt a lot from him. If you attend  classes, you will do well. 

The materials and tests are not easy. You will work a lot in the course through HWs and Quizzes. 

Tests are graded in the same day. He responded promptly to emails. 
Very nice and really cares about students.

Dr. Yousef is a great professor. Probably the most helpful professor I had during graduate school. Very caring, lenient and generous at grading, I learned a lot from him, especially in MATLAB and Simulink. Take his class and attend all his lectures and you will most probably get an A.

Organized materials and the professor is really helpful. He solves many problems in class which made HWs and exams easier. He is kind and gives many opportunities to learn. I like his interactions in the lab with students. Very few professors are like him. I would definitely recommend him.
He is very average. His lectures can be quite boring, but he is very fair with what he questions you on. I would take him again.
